title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 360-5.11 - Evaluation of disability
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 360-5.11 - Evaluation of disability

State Regulations

Factors other than medical should be taken into
consideration, where appropriate, in making a determination of disability
status. These additional factors include the age of the individual, education
and training, and previous work history. The determination of disability must
encompass an evaluation of a combination of the individual's medical and social
factors. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
§§
360-5.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
